Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2011 03:31PM dontworrybehappy wrote: please add me to the august group i had my surgery on august 3rd, bmx immediate diep reconstruction, i am definately part of the club. thk
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2011 04:41PM dontworrybehappy wrote: now i realize how blessed i was to find my general surgeon, he was referred to me by my female obgyn. the whole consulation he gave me the list of all my options and kept reminding me that it was "my choice". whatever i chose. words that were also repeated by the plastic surgeon my general surgeon likes to work with. i was given all the choices, withthe plastic surgeon, he was real honest that the best physical result would come from the diep procedure, and a tummy tuck paid for by insurance was what did it for me. ive had fake boobs my whole life, so i know i could never have boobs that would look as perfect as the old ones did because of loss of breast tissue. i only had breast cancer in one boob and i elected to have my $8000 boobjob redue removed to smaller size c maybe little d's, and the flatest stomach. my friends who originally felt sorry for me until they saw that at 50 i have bigger and perkier real boobs and a knock out stomach. my husband is cool with what ever decision i make. the whole loss of nipple sensation means he's gonna have to spend alot more time somewhere else. mybest friend had cancer and only did lumpectomy and she just had a mammagram and said it was the most pain she has in a long time. i dont ever have to have any mammagram , i didnt need chemo or rad, just tamoxifen. im only going to miss 2 mos of work because i have to be able to lift a certain amount to be able to work, but thats okay because its too hot in aug and sept. ive met my medical out of pocket spending for the year andnext year by this time i wont even be thinking about breast cancer. the other day i wore a real cute printed tunic, braless, because i dont have nipples it didnt matter that it was shear. my best friend that only had a lumpectomy wished she had gotten the diep. im glad i will never ever has capsular contraction with the implants. both times i had boob jobs, since i was 27, i alway ended up with at least one hard boobie and its expensive to keep having them replaced. and you will never believe this but i have the best cleavage i have ever had and thats without a bra. so it took a real leap of faith for a 34G to take the chance and remove both perfect beauties for something so out there, just for symmetry, tummy tuck and no more implants, i guess i was ready for
Posts.Title: Groan, groan, Really bad meeting with PS tarry dontworrybehappy

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2011 11:10AM dontworrybehappy wrote: because of stories like yours, ive realized that i too can make it to retirement, and i better make sure ive saved enough money to enjoy it. this past summer when i was diagnosed i catastraphized the worst. i did not think i had a future. i chose a bilat mast and was told i didnt need chemo or rads, just 5 yrs tamox. i feel like i have another chance at life. i stopped drinking 22 yrs ago, that was my first rebirth. then i found a "higher power", reborn again and now being faced with my mortality, i was going to face that higher power before i really wanted to. i will admit, that before my diagnosis i was in a place of "now what", i felt like i was in that movie ground hog day. the same day over and over again. breast cancer changed everything. im even more greatful everyday that i wake up, and have another day. ive become outspoken to every women i meet about getting in for mammos and ultrasounds and checking her breasts in different ways that they say we are supposed to do it. i felt mine while scratcing and tapping my breast. who new. the best thing i ever learned from the 12 step program is the slogan " one day at a time". because that all any of us have. theres also another quote from a song, "dont try to live your whole life in one day". i always joked about living long enough to spend my 401k. so if thats true, the more i put in, the longer ill live. haha i wish that was true. if not, i sure put a dent in my beneficiaries debt. congrats, i will be posting my sixteen years here as well.
Posts.Title: Celebrating 17 years since diagnosed Hauntie cp418

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2011 12:14AM dontworrybehappy wrote: i have a completely different perspective on this. i basically destroyed the good sensations in my nipples by piercing them years ago . they never really healed and i took the jewelry out. after that my nipples were just for looks and the nipples off limits because of the unpleasant sensation. i had the diep recon and nipples last month. i look amazing. there is feeling on the skin of my breasts, but nothing erotic. this maybe TMI but by husbands and my favorite position has always been doggy style, so boobies dont even matter at that point. my ps used ear carliage inside the nipples to give them projection. if i go braless it looks like my headlights are on, which still turns a head or too while we walk through home depot. my husband has always said that i am the "whole package" from the inside out. the tummy tuck that came along with the DIEP procedure gave me a flatter stomach then ive ever had. i think like my husband that confidence is sexier than body parts. not all men have both testicles, and not all men are "well endowed", but that doesnt stop them from being sexy or masculine. before my mastectomy, i had an 8,000 boob job, 34 dddd. im now a 34d and am doing just fine with a much smaller chest. my ps did not advise not having the recon, which i origionally wanted. after seeing what he could do with the DIEP, i now know why it was advisable to have the surgery, my eyes are tricking me that these are real boobies. ill have the tatoos in march to complete the look. i will look so real. people say i look like ive lost weight. not a bad trade off. i tell people that i feel like i his the breast cancer lottery, a breast reduction and tummy tuck that insurance paid for , hell ya.
Posts.Title: I miss my breasts! topless karen1956

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2011 11:36AM dontworrybehappy wrote: i became my dads nurse when he had cancer. you will always be able to look back on this with a smile as to how much courage god gives us to do what we do for others, esp. our loved ones in a difficult time. this experience will empower you and make you stronger. maybe nursing is your calling.
Posts.Title: Now I'm a nurse. sincitydealer apple

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 05:04PM dontworrybehappy wrote: once again this website never ceases to amaze me. we come here with whatever is going on and there are always others who have had the same thing or similar or know someone else who has been through the same situation. thank for you for sharing with some us complete strangers, youll never know how many other people you are helping and how you touch their lives when i think of where we are at with technology, maybe not far enough yet, but to atleast have the opportunity to have a procedure available to us for things half the time a cannot pronounce or spell, it makes me so grateful to know they exist and help i know the procedure will go great and excellent aftercare blessings for you, i wish you all the best, once again this disease shows me another facet of what its capable of,what next.
Posts.Title: Latest good time: surgery PJB PJB

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 04:59PM dontworrybehappy wrote: i wish that i had found this website 2 weeks into my cancer. turn her on to it. here she can share her feelings, thoughts and question day or night. she has all of us here going through various stages of breast cancer she is our sister too. she can look forward to posting on this website and other women ALWAYS respond. i start my morning on this website and end my day on this site. get connected with us, everything is here, from serious to silly to i hate cancer. what also helped me was looking at before and after pictures of women who have a mastectomies with reconstruction on breastcenter.com. that site has literally hundreds of photos that gave me encouragement of how great women look after reconstruction. i have an ipad so i can find hot spots all over the place to access this site. this site has helped me more mentally and emotionally than my friends, family or husband, because no oneknows more about what she is going through than we do. please encourage her to check us out, there are some wild, informative, silly, compassionate ladies in this club that no one wantsto be a member of. i have a newer purpose in life to add to my resume, now i can add breast cancer survivor and i owe it to anyone reaching out to lend a hand if they will take it. good for you for finding us.
Posts.Title: When does life go back to normal? GetSparky dontworrybehappy
